page.title: 03HINXWORTH AREA : EDWORTH
page.content: Edworth is a small agricultural parish of 1122 acres with the A1 forming the SW boundary. Only a few of the original houses of the village remain and are scattered about the parish. The more modern village consists of late 19th century houses and some 20th century bungalows almost all of which are owned by the farms and rented out. Few of the inhabitants now work on the land due to mechanisation. Most have cars because public transport is limited. The land is almost entirely given over to corn growing and cattle grazing. The church which stood in its present position in 1200 AD was restored 10 years ago but is now redundant. With most houses 'off the beaten track' a stranger to the area might drive through Edworth without realising. The population is less then 50 but has recently stopped declining.
